json.text: Hey everyone! Welcome back to my channel this is Dori, I'm a teacher of English and today
we're going to have a look at a model answer of IELTS Speaking PART 2. Ok, let's go!
Ok this is an example of a model answer for Part 2 probably the men who watched that will laugh at my
answer but you know what? I did this on purpose in order to show you that there is no right or wrong answer
you can talk about a topic even if you are not familiar with something as long as you are organised
and you talk as much as you can on each bullet point on topic of course fluently without a lot of pauses
and you connect your ideas together in a very cohesive, smooth way If you don't know something very well,
it doesn't matter just state that beforehand and start talking as you would in your mother language
and please don't pause or panic or things like that take advantage of the fact that you don't know
something. Ok, this answer was probably  band 9 you don't have to be that perfect at all no but as long as you keep this organisation
in your mind and aim for that I am sure that you'll do great
